title: How to Make Cheese Crisps

steps.headline: Take a slice of provolone, mozzarella, Parmesan, or even cheddar cheese.
Use a non-stick frying pan and put your cheese slice on it.
Turn on heat around a 5 to 6.
Wait until your cheese is bubbly and brown.
After flipping it, wait about 2 minutes, or until the other side is brown.
Turn off your heat, and take your cheese crisp off the pan.
Put the cheese crisp onto a fine strainer.
Flip it while in the strainer.
Wait about five minutes while it is in the strainer.
Blend the cheese and chips into the softened butter.
steps.description: Use a blender or food processor.

steps.headline: Add the blended ingredients to the dry ingredients.
Using a teaspoon, scoop out the mixture.
Press or roll each amount into a sausage shape.
steps.description: Put onto a parchment paper covered baking sheet/tray. Place in the fridge to firm.

steps.headline: Remove after half an hour or when firmed.
Bake.
steps.description: Bake for 12 minutes or until lightly browned.

text: Method 1 Take a slice of provolone, mozzarella, Parmesan, or even cheddar cheese.  Use a non-stick frying pan and put your cheese slice on it.  Turn on heat around a 5 to 6.  Wait until your cheese is bubbly and brown.  Flip it over!  After flipping it, wait about 2 minutes, or until the other side is brown.  Turn off your heat, and take your cheese crisp off the pan.  Put the cheese crisp onto a fine strainer.  Flip it while in the strainer.  Wait about five minutes while it is in the strainer.  Take it off and munch!  Method 2 Blend the cheese and chips into the softened butter. Use a blender or food processor. Add the blended ingredients to the dry ingredients. Mix together to combine. Using a teaspoon, scoop out the mixture.  Press or roll each amount into a sausage shape. Put onto a parchment paper covered baking sheet/tray. Place in the fridge to firm. Remove after half an hour or when firmed. Preheat the oven to 375ºC. Bake. Bake for 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
